page.title: 09Llanharan Open Coal Mine
page.content: Since the closure of{Llanharan {Colliery}in 1962 the area has developed into one of the largest opencast sites in the country. The fact that{Llanharan}stands on the Southern outcrop of the South Wales coalfied means that the coal is near the surface and{open cast}mining is economical. The coal produced at the mine is coking coal and is used in steel works at Port Talbot.About half a million tons per year are produced. The N.C.B. and the contractors Derek Crouch wish to extend the site, but there is a great deal of local opposition. When the life of the open cast mine comes to an end, the land will be restored, with some returning to agriculture, some to forestry and some becoming a lake.It is hoped that the area will become a tourist attraction.
